Robots will be able to kill without human control in the future. This would be harmful and not morally right. We need to be very cautious indeed about what we ask machines to do.

Overall, more people are learning English than the other languages combined and English is spoken in the highest number of countries.  However, Chinese has by far the greatest number of native speakers.  It’s not easy to predict how many learners a language will have based on how many native speakers it has. But if a language is spoken in many countries, more people will likely learn it.

The manager needs to talk to you. It's about your work on the recent project. You felt worried all weekend. You thought about what you might have done incorrectly. She starts your Monday meeting by saying good things about your work on the project. You then wonder if she is going to give you criticism after the praise. When giving feedback, it helps to be positive. Start with something you like, share your concerns, and then finish with something positive.

This rock album, Born in the USA, is energetic and makes you want to tap your feet. But the words in the songs are also very emotional. The popular melodies in these rock songs hide stories about the failures of the American dream. Regular people often struggle, and many songs express their sadness and anger about this. They feel disappointed when life doesn’t give them success. The song Glory  The story "Days" looks at people in a small town and their pasts. "Downbound Train" is about a young man whose life changes for the worse when he becomes unemployed. We can guess the artist created his work thinking about friends and family, and what his life would be like without fame. The album will leave you in no doubt of the unique and extraordinary talent of the Boss.

Lewis believes we need to protect more of the ocean. He wants to see ocean protection increase from 3% to 10% of the world’s oceans. This is to help repair damage from things like overfishing and pollution. Lewis experienced the environmental damage himself on his trips. He swam over coral reefs that had turned white because the water was warmer. He also saw underwater areas with no life in the Red Sea. These areas were covered in plastic. Pugh thinks nature can get better if we let it. But we don't have much time. If we don't start looking after our seas, we may soon have an unsolvable problem on our hands.

Best-selling author  Once you provide the sentence, I will give you five simplified versions as requested. Sharp is a skilled storyteller, and he has won the Olive Crime award two times. Writer Award.  She grew up in a dangerous neighborhood in Glasgow. She learned to be quiet and avoid problems. She also learned how to steal cars using a knife. She only wrote novels with her knowledge. She is now more public, appearing on shows and at conferences in the UK.

Are things getting worse every day?  Is progress an impossible goal?  During the Enlightenment, people in Europe began to question old ideas about power and tradition. Now, Steven Pinker looks at the big picture of human progress and finds good news.  We are living longer, and our lives are better in many ways – we are healthier and happier, and we have more freedom. According to Pinker, the biggest issue is a decline in support for reason and scientific thinking. When people use strong group feelings, a belief that things cannot be changed, and a lack of trust, democracy and global teamwork are at risk of serious, lasting harm.

Old horror films often showed characters who couldn't call for help when they were in danger. It’s now more difficult to accept that situation as true, thanks to cell phones. What's the solution to maintain suspense?  No phone coverage!  In horror films, heroes usually find they have no cell service at the worst possible time – when they need to call for help. Your phone battery might run out while you are calling. Or both.

Central American banana farmers in the 1950s faced a crisis because the ‘Big Mike’ banana, which made them a lot of money, was disappearing. Now, the same thing is happening to the banana called Cavendish. The Gros Michel banana was a very important crop in Central America. Its fruit was sweet, had a thick peel, and was easy to move around. The biggest banana company in South America was United Fruit. They found a fast way to grow bananas: they used pieces of plants instead of seeds, and they planted many plants in a small area.

Most spiders have poison that they use to catch their food. This poison is not usually dangerous to humans. There are many spider types, but only 25 have venom dangerous to humans. While a spider bite might hurt, it is usually not life-threatening. The Sydney funnel-web spider is known to be dangerous. However, a treatment was created in 1981, and since then, no one has died from its bite in Australia. Tarantulas and other hairy spiders don't like to be touched the wrong way, so be careful. If they feel threatened, they shoot out hairs that can cause pain. The hairs bother people and can go into their skin or eyes.

This horror film cliché was especially popular with horror films of the late 20th century.  It starts with a group of teenagers all enjoying themselves, and it ends with everyone dead except one girl.  At first, the girl is typically innocent, shy, and weak. She became very strong and resourceful after a long time. The final girl almost always succeeds.

To understand how humans developed complex language, we need to study the human brain and compare it to the brains of other animals. What our brains can do is as important as their size. We also need to know why and when these abilities developed. There are not many physical signs to help us understand ancient speech. We can learn about early humans by studying their bones. One thing we see is changes in their mouths, throats, and tongues. Humans could make detailed sounds by 100,000 years ago. Scientists who study evolution could only make educated guesses about how early people talked.

Society, not nature, teaches girls to like subjects like art and history, and boys to like subjects like math and science. Coupled with this is the lack of positive female role models youngsters see doing science-related jobs.  Cartoons and stories usually present these roles – scientist, inventor, and astronaut – as being filled by men. There's a common belief that scientists are not very social and their jobs are isolating. Media stereotypes about scientists are not true. These stereotypes can discourage girls from choosing science as a career. If girls saw more positive female role models in science it would give them more confidence and a greater sense of belonging in those subjects.

The Scallion is printed weekly and distributed free in faculty buildings, with a readership of approximately 10,000 students.  It is written and produced entirely by students.  The survey shows that the newspaper is highly valued by university students and staff for entertainment, cultural enrichment and work experience.  Newspapers have high printing costs. Furthermore, some students do not have easy access to the paper, since the only way to obtain a copy is to physically go to university.  An additional environmental issue is that a large number of copies end up as litter on campus.

Girox Foods sees 12% of its employees leave each year. Although this might not seem high at first glance, the industry standard is seven per cent.  This report looks at the reasons employees are engaged with their jobs. Based on these reasons, we will recommend changes to improve the work environment and reduce employee turnover.

So much of what the speaker said rang true.  I honestly believe there's a danger that the more connected we are, the more isolated we feel.  I don't think this is such an issue for my generation who've lived without technology for so long.  We know how to be alone and, more importantly, we know that it's OK to be alone.  But the under 20s are another kettle of fish.  People are busy talking and connecting with others all the time. They might not have time to be alone, and they might not learn to like being with themselves. They are practicing conversations by sending messages they can edit. However, this could make it harder to have real-time conversations with people nearby.

It's better not to follow a compliment with a complaint. If we always receive both praise and criticism, the praise can lose its importance. Give praise sometimes just to encourage people. Don't always focus on what needs improvement.
